application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Mature Oak tree in the rear garden. It has been previously cut back and is now in a fair condition.
The amenity of the tree is medium due to its appearance and the value it adds to the area.

Due to previous pruning from the application 44589/2019 the tree has gone into a stress form. This has caused epicormic shoots throughout the inner crown. Because of the stress the tree is currently under, the specification is too severe.
The application is refused due to the stress the tree is under. Removing epicormic shoots throughout the inner canopy would be a preferable specification, but would need a new application.
description: To carry out tree surgery - to crown reduce by 2.5m to previous pruning points One Oak at T1 within TPO 315
